intro: Pseudathyrium, commonly known as the false thyme, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apiaceae. These plants are characterized by their small, aromatic leaves and showy umbels of white or pink flowers. They are native to various regions in the Northern Hemisphere, including Europe, Asia, and North America. Pseudathyrium species often thrive in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream sides. The genus includes several species, some of which are cultivated for their ornamental value and fragrance.
